alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:37PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Northampton, Greensville, Southampton, northwestern York, Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie, southern James City, southern Gloucester, southeastern Charles City, Prince George, Surry and southeastern Brunswick Counties, the southeastern City of Petersburg, the City of Emporia and the City of Williamsburg through 315 PM EST... At 236 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stony Creek to 7 miles south of Warrenton. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Roanoke Rapids, Williamsburg, Emporia, Gloucester Courthouse, Waverly, Courtland, Garysburg, Wakefield, Boykins, Claremont, Surry, Queens Lake, Disputanta, Dahlia, College Of William And Mary, Purdy, Fort Lee, Gloucester Point and Prince George. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
